page.title: 06Public Transport, Buckden
page.content: The growth of the village in recent years has been largely due to its position next to fast roads and railway lines. Many people in the village commute daily to Bedford, Cambridge, Peterborough or southwards to the Stevenage, Hitchen area and London. { Roads - }The A1 provides a fast north south route, the A604 to Cambridge. { Rail - }Nearest station Huntingdon. Local and intercity service. { Bus - }United counties routes 211 and 212 from Huntingdon to Bedford stop in the village. Whippet buses (St. Ives) provide day trips as well as a daily service to London.
